meanings.definition: The enlargement of an organ or tissue from the increase in size of its cells.
meanings.sent1: The hypertrophy of his muscles made him stronger.
meanings.sent2: The doctor explained that hypertrophy of the heart can be a serious condition.
meanings.sent3: The plant's hypertrophy was so extreme that it needed a bigger pot.
meanings.sent4: Her love for him seemed to hypertrophy with each passing day.
meanings.sent5: The hypertrophy of the balloon made it impossible to fit through the door.

meanings.sent1: He hoped his muscles would hypertrophy after regular exercise.
meanings.sent2: Athletes often hypertrophy their muscles through intense training.
meanings.sent3: The cake seemed to hypertrophy in the oven, rising higher than expected.
meanings.sent4: His determination to succeed began to hypertrophy, driving him to work harder.
meanings.sent5: The tree's branches appeared to hypertrophy in the lush forest environment.
